definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To attract with bait ; to entice .
( transitive ) To affix bait to a trap or a fishing hook or fishing line .
( transitive ) To lay baits in an environment to control pest species.
( transitive ) To target a pest species by laying baits.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To attract with bait ; to entice .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To affix bait to a trap or a fishing hook or fishing line .
( transitive ) To lay baits in an environment to control pest species.
( transitive ) To target a pest species by laying baits.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To set dogs on (an animal etc.) to bite or worry ; to attack with dogs, especially for sport.
examples: to bait a bear with dogs

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To intentionally annoy , torment , or threaten by constant rebukes or threats; to harass .
( transitive , archaic ) To feed and water (a horse or other animal), especially during a journey.
( intransitive ) Of a horse or other animal: to take food , especially during a journey.
( intransitive ) ( of a person ) To stop to take a portion of food and drink for refreshment during a journey.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To set dogs on (an animal etc.) to bite or worry ; to attack with dogs, especially for sport.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To intentionally annoy , torment , or threaten by constant rebukes or threats; to harass .
( transitive , archaic ) To feed and water (a horse or other animal), especially during a journey.
( intransitive ) Of a horse or other animal: to take food , especially during a journey.
( intransitive ) ( of a person ) To stop to take a portion of food and drink for refreshment during a journey.

definitions.definition: To flap the wings ; to flutter as if to fly ; or to hover , as a hawk when she stoops to her prey .

main_definition: ( obsolete , intransitive ) To flap the wings ; to flutter as if to fly ; or to hover , as a hawk when she stoops to her prey .
